intro: Silene brotheriana, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada silene, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats at high elevations. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Silene brotheriana is considered a rare and endangered species.
